title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission comes as solar activity triggered an alert from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for a severe geomagnetic storm alert, which could impact the Starlink satellites. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 40 at 1:01 a.m. EDT (0501 UTC) on June 2.

title: Trump pulls Isaacman nomination for space. Source: “NASA is f****ed”
summary: "NASA's budget request is just a going-out-of-business mode" without Isaacman.

title: President Trump withdraws Isaacman nomination for NASA Administrator days before Senate confirmation vote
summary: Jared Isaacman, an entrepreneur who flew to space twice as a commercial astronaut, was nominated for the position in early December and was voted favorably out of committee in late April. A replacement hasn’t been named.

title: White House to withdraw Isaacman nomination to lead NASA
summary:
The White House is withdrawing the nomination of Jared Isaacman to be administrator of NASA, throwing an agency already reeling from proposed massive budget cuts into further disarray.
The post White House to withdraw Isaacman nomination to lead NASA appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Jared Isaacman Out as NASA Administrator Nominee
summary: Today the White House announced it is withdrawing Jared Isaacman’s nomination to be NASA Administrator. The reason given is that the Administrator must be “in complete alignment with President Trump’s […]

title: Blue Origin performs 12th crewed New Shepard suborbital flight
summary:
Blue Origin sent six people to space on a suborbital spaceflight May 31 that the company’s chief executive says is both a good business and a way to test technology.
The post Blue Origin performs 12th crewed New Shepard suborbital flight appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: West Coast Falcon 9 to launch 27 satellites for SpaceX’s Starlink internet service
summary: The mission will the 25th flight of the Falcon 9 first stage booster, tail number 1071. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base at 1:10 p.m. PDT (4:10 p.m. EDT, 2010 UTC).

title: NASA budget would cancel dozens of science missions, lay off thousands
summary:
NASA released more details about its proposed fiscal year 2026 budget May 30, canceling dozens of science missions and cutting thousands of jobs.
The post NASA budget would cancel dozens of science missions, lay off thousands appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: SpaceX launches latest GPS III satellite for U.S. military
summary:
GPS III SV-08, built by Lockheed Martin, is the eighth of 10 GPS III spacecraft.
